Description: ACTINN (Automated Cell Type Identification using Neural Networks) is a bioinformatic tool to quickly and accurately identify cell types in scRNA-Seq.

ACTION infers the functional identity of cells from their transcriptional profile, classifies them based on their dominant function, and reconstructs regulatory networks that are responsible for mediating their identity.
Robust multi-resolution analysis of single-cell datasets
Generate QC reports summarizing the output from an alevin run
ALRA is a method for imputation of missing values in single cell RNA-sequencing data
AltAnalyze is a multi-functional and easy-to-use software package for automated single-cell and bulk gene and splicing analyses.
Find bimodal, unimodal, and multimodal features in your data
ASAP : Automated Single-cell Analysis Pipeline
Analysis of Single Cell Expresssion Normalisation and Differential Expression
AUCell is an R-package to analyze the state of gene-sets in single-cell RNA-seq data (i.e. identify cells with active gene signatures).
Augur is an R package to prioritize cell types involved in the response to an experimental perturbation within high-dimensional single-cell data.
AutoImpute: Autoencoder based imputation of single cell RNA-seq data
Biclustering algorithm developed taking into account intrinsic features of single-cell RNA-seq experiments.
Bayesian approach for detecting copy number alterations from single cell RNA-seq data
BALDR is a pipeline for reconstructing human or rhesus macaque immunoglobulin(Ig)/B cell receptor(BCR) sequences from single cell RNA-Seq data generated by Illumina sequencing.
A Bayesian mixture model for clustering droplet-based single cell transcriptomic data from population studies
BASIC is a semi-de novo assembly method to determine the full-length sequence of the BCR in single B cells from scRNA-seq data.

Bayesian Analysis of single-cell RNA-seq data. Estimates cell-specific normalization constants. Technical variability is quantified based on spike-in genes. The total variability of the expression counts is decomposed into technical and biological components.
BasisVAE: Translation-invariant feature-level clustering with Variational Autoencoders
Implements a variety of methods for batch correction of single-cell (RNA sequencing) data.
BATMAN is a novel tool for batch effect correction (integration) of single-cell RNA-Seq datasets.
bayNorm provides an efficient, integrated solution for global scaling normalisation, imputation and true count recovery of gene expression measurements from scRNA-seq data
BBKNN is a fast and intuitive batch effect removal tool for direct use in the scanpy workflow.
Projected t-SNE for Batch Correction
A python toolkit providing best-practice pipelines for fully automated high throughput sequencing analysis.
R package for bcbio single-cell RNA-seq analysis
BCseq: accurate single cell RNA-seq quantification with bias correction
BEARscc is a noise estimation and injection tool that is designed to assess putative single-cell RNA-seq clusters in the context of experimental noise estimated by ERCC spike-in controls.
BEELINE: Benchmarking gEnE reguLatory network Inference from siNgle-cEll transcriptomic data
BEER: Batch EffEct Remover for single-cell data
A novel transfer-learning-based method for batch-effect correction in single cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data
bigSCale is an analytical framework scalable to analyze millions of cells

bigSCale is a complete framework for the analysis and visualization of single cell data. It allows  cluster, phenotype, perform pseudotime analysis, infer gene regulatory networks and reduce large datasets in smaller datasets with higher quality.
BIRD: Big data Regression for predicting DNase I hypersensitivity
Bayesian Inference for Single-cell Clustering and ImpuTing
An R toolkit for accurate and efficient estimation of cell composition ('decomposition') from bulk expression data with single-cell information.
Transform percentage-based units into a 2d space to evaluate changes in distribution with both magnitude and direction.
Beta-Poisson model for single-cell RNA-seq data analyses
BraCeR - reconstruction of B cell receptor sequences from single-cell RNA-seq data.
BranchedGP is a package for building Branching Gaussian process models in python, using TensorFlow and GPFlow.
BRAPeS (BCR Reconstruction Algorithm for Paired-End Single-cell), software for reconstruction of B cell receptors (BCR) using short, paired-end single-cell RNA-sequencing.

BREMSC is an R package (with core functions jointDIMMSC and BREMSC) for joint clustering droplet-based scRNA-seq and CITE-seq data. jointDIMMSC is developed as a direct extension of DIMMSC, which assumes full indenpendency between single cell RNA and surface protein data. To take the correlation between two data sources into consideration, we further develop BREMSC, which uses random effects to incorporate the two data sources. This package can directly work on raw count data from droplet-based scRNA-seq and CITE-seq experiments without any data transformation, and it can provide clustering uncertainty for each cell.
BRIE (Bayesian regression for isoform estimate) is a Bayesian method to estimate isoform proportions from RNA-seq data.

BSeq-sc is a bioinformatics analysis pipeline that leverages single-cell sequencing data to estimate cell type proportion and cell type-specific gene expression differences from RNA-seq data from bulk tissue samples.
BTR is a model learning algorithm for reconstructing and training asynchronous Boolean models using single-cell expression data.
The BUSseq R package implements the BUSseq model to adjust single-cell RNA-sequencing data for batch effects when there are unknown cell types.
bustools is a program for manipulating BUS files for single cell RNA-Seq datasets
Provides a maximum likelihood estimation of Bivariate Zero-Inflated Negative Binomial (BZINB) model or the nested model parameters.
CALISTA provides a user-friendly toolbox for the analysis of single cell expression data.
The CancerInSilico package provides an R interface for running mathematical models of tumor progresson.
CAPITAL, a method for comparing pseudotime trajectories with tree alignment whereby trajectories including branching can be compared without any knowledge of paths to be compared.
Capybara is a tool to measure cell identity and fate transitions
Methods to infer clonal structure for a population of cells using single-cell RNA-seq data
Identify large-scale CNV events from single cell or bulk RNA-Seq data
Classification of Single cells by Transfer Learning
Mutation barcode caller, calls mutant and ref barcodes from 10x single cell data
single-cell RNA-seq data analysis using Bayesian non-negative matrix factorization
Coupled-Clone Nonnegative Matrix Factorization (CCNMF) is a method for joint inference of clonal structure using paired Single-cell DNA-Seq and RNA-Seq data
Implements a method for identifying and removing the cell-cycle effect from scRNA-Seq data.
CCSN can be used for cell clustering and dimension reduction on a network basis of single cells

The celaref (cell labelling by reference) package aims to streamline the cell-type identification step, by suggesting cluster labels on the basis of similarity to an already-characterised reference dataset.

"celda" stands for "CEllular Latent Dirichlet Allocation", which is a suite of Bayesian hierarchical models and supporting functions to perform gene and cell clustering for count data generated by single cell RNA-seq platforms.
Cell BLAST is a cell querying tool for single-cell transcriptomics data.
CellAlign is a tool for quantitative comparison of expression dynamics within or between single-cell trajectories.
cellassign automatically assigns single-cell RNA-seq data to known cell types across thousands of cells accounting for patient and batch specific effects.
R package for benchmarking single cell analysis methods, primarily inspired by the modelling structure used in DSC
CellBender is a software package for eliminating technical artifacts from high-throughput single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data
CellBIC is bimodality-based top-down clustering of single-cell RNA sequencing data.
Python pipeline and Javascript scatter plot library for single-cell datasets
CellFishing.jl (cell finder via hashing) is a tool to find similar cells of query cells based on their transcriptome expression profiles.
Classification of low quality cells in scRNA-seq data using R
CellO (Cell Ontology-based classification) is a Python package for performing cell type classification of RNA-seq data.
CellPhoneDB is a publicly available repository of curated receptors, ligands and interactions.
Cell Ranger is a set of analysis pipelines that process Chromium single cell 3 RNA-seq output to align reads, generate gene-cell matrices and perform clustering and gene expression analysis.

CellRouter is a multifaceted single-cell analysis platform that identifies complex cell-state transition trajectories by using flow networks to explore the subpopulation structure of multi-dimensional, single-cell omics data.
cellSNP aims to pileup the expressed alleles in single-cell or bulk RNA-seq data, which can be directly used for donor deconvolution in multiplexed single-cell RNA-seq data
Identify Clonal Identity from scRNA-seq and CellTag Data
CellTrails: Inference of Temporal Gene Expression Dynamics of Branching Biological Processes from Single-cell Expression Data
Cell population analysis and visualization from single cell RNA-seq data using a Latent Dirichlet Allocation model.
A ShinyApp to visualize and explore single cell datasets
cellxgene is an interactive data explorer for single-cell transcriptomics datasets, such as those coming from the Human Cell Atlas

Cerebro, cell report browser, (currently available for macOS and Windows) which allows users to interactively visualize various parts of single cell transcriptomics data without requiring bioinformatic expertise.
CHETAH (CHaracterization of cEll Types Aided by Hierarchical clustering): a selective, hierarchical cell type identification method for single-cell RNA sequencing
Ultrafast and accurate clustering through imputation and dimensionality reduction for single-cell RNA-seq data.

CiteFuse is a streamlined package consisting of a suite of tools for pre-processing, modality integration, clustering, differential RNA and ADT expression analysis, ADT evaluation, ligand-receptor interaction analysis, and interactive web-based visualization of CITE-seq data
A python package that allows to count antibody TAGS from a CITE-seq and/or cell hashing experiment.
A normalization method to remove unwanted variation using both control and target genes.
clonealign assigns single-cell RNA-seq expression to cancer clones by mapping RNA-seq to clone-specific copy number profiles
Representative marker selection, cluster, visualization, and binomial differential expression pipeline
Functions for running and comparing many different clusterings of single-cell sequencing data. Meant to work with SCONE and slingshot.

Clustergrammer2 is an interactive WebGL heatmap Jupyter widget that is built to help researchers interactively explore single cell data (e.g. scRNA-seq). Clustergrammer2 enables unbiased hierarchical clustering, integration of prior knowledge categories, and the generation of novel signatures.
ClusterMap is an R package to analyze and compare two or more single cell expression datasets
ClusterMine is a knowledge-integrated clustering approach to cluster samples based on gene expression profile.

The clustermole R package provides a comprehensive meta collection of cell identity markers for thousands of human and mouse cell types sourced from a variety of databases as well as methods to query them.
Classify cells from single-cell RNA sequencing data using external reference data (e.g., bulk RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, microarray, gene lists).
CMF-Impute: an accurate imputation tool for single-cell RNA-seq data
Consensus Non-negative Matrix Factorization on single-cell RNA-Seq data
Convolutional neural network co-expression analysis (CNNC)
Component Overlapping Attribute Clustering (COAC) algorithm to perform the localized (subpopulation) gene co-expression network analysis from large-scale scRNA-seq profiles
COMET: Identifying candidate marker panels from single-cell transcriptomic data
CONCLUS is a tool for robust clustering and positive marker features selection of single-cell RNA-seq (sc-RNA-seq) datasets.
CONICS: COpy-Number analysis In single-Cell RNA-Sequencing
Clustering on Network of Samples
Consistent Clusters for scRNA-seq

Clustering and Visualizing RNA-Seq Expression Data using Grade of Membership Models. Fits grade of membership models (GoM, also known as admixture models) to cluster RNA-seq gene expression count data, identifies characteristic genes driving cluster memberships, and provides a visual summary of the cluster memberships.
A coupled co-clustering-based unsupervised transfer learning algorithm (coupleCoC) for the integrative analysis of multimodal single-cell data
CSHMM accurately infers branching topology in time series data and correctly and continuously assign cells to paths
Continuous-State Hidden Markov Models TF (CSHMM-TF) method which integrates probabilistic modeling of scRNA-Seq data with the ability to assign TFs to specific activation points in the learned model

CSMF (Common and Specific Matrix Factorization) is a MATLAB package to simultaneously extract common and specific patterns from the data of two or multiple biological interrelated conditions via matrix factorization.
Cell-specific Network Constructed from Single-cell RNA Sequencing Data
A computational strategy to infer cellular interaction from scRNA-seq
ctgGEM is an R package that combines a variety of visualization packages for single cell RNA tree hierarchies
Single cell Transcriptome to Protein prediction with deep neural networks
Cyclum is a package to recover cell cycle information and remove cell cycle factors from scRNA-seq data
A computational method for de novo constructing cell type-specific signal transduction networks using single-cell RNA-Seq data

D3E is a tool for identifying differentially-expressed genes, based on single-cell RNA-seq data. D3E consists of two modules: one for identifying differentially expressed (DE) genes, and one for fitting the parameters of a Poisson-Beta distribution.
DC3: Deconvolution and coupled clustering from bulk and single cell genomics data

A deep count autoencoder network to denoise scRNA-seq data and remove the dropout effect by taking the count structure, overdispersed nature and sparsity of the data into account using a deep autoencoder with zero-inflated negative binomial (ZINB) loss function.
Finding dominant latent signals that regulate dynamic correlation between many pairs of variables.
A tool for processing Bio-Rad ddSEQ single cell RNA-seq data
Differential Expression with Capture Efficiency AdjustmeNT for Single-Cell RNA-seq Data
DECODE-ing sparsity patterns in single-cell RNA-seq
Decomposition into Extended Exponential Family
DeepImpute: an accurate and efficient deep learning method for single-cell RNA-seq data imputation
R package to model time series accounting for noise in the temporal dimension. Specifically designed for single cell transcriptome experiments.
Genetic multiplexing of barcoded single cell RNA-seq

DENDRO, stands for Dna based EvolutioNary tree preDiction by scRna-seq technOlogy, is an R package, which takes scRNA-seq data for a tumor (or related somatic tissues) and accurately reconstructs its phylogeny, assigning each single cell from the single cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data to a subclone.
DendroSplit, an interpretable framework for analyzing single-cell RNA-Seq datasets.
densityCut is an efficient density-based clustering algorithm to analyze large-scale biological data
DensityPath can accurately and efficiently reconstruct the underlying cell developmental trajectories for large-scale scRNAseq data.
DepecheR is an R package for clustering cytometry and single-cell RNA sequencing data according to a minimal set of biological markers
DESC is an unsupervised deep learning algorithm for clustering scRNA-seq data.
DESCEND deconvolves the true gene expression distribution across cells for UMI scRNA-seq counts

DEsingle is an R package for differential expression (DE) analysis of single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data. It will detect differentially expressed genes between two groups of cells in a scRNA-seq raw read counts matrix.
Diffusion maps for single-cell RNA-seq.
Denoising Expression data with a Weighted Affinity Kernel and Self-Supervision
Python module applying deep learning to improve clustering and other analysis of single-cell genomic data (gene expression and copy number variation).
Debris Identification using Expectation Maximization
Identification of hematological cell types from heterogeneous single cell RNA-seq data.
DIMMSC is an R package for clustering droplet-based single cell transcriptomic data. It uses Dirichlet mixture prior to characterize variations across different clusters.
Distributions of Isoforms in Single Cell Omics
distinct is a statistical method to perform differential testing between two or more groups of distributions
DistMap can be used to spatially map single cell RNA sequencing data by using an existing reference database of in situs.
A set of functions built to enable analysis and visualization of single cell and bulk RNA-sequencing data by novice and/or color blind coders
Dmatch facilitates alignment of scRNA-seq datasets with cell-types that may overlap only partially
A cell-state aware tool for removing doublets from single-cell RNA-seq data.
DoubletDetection is a Python3 package to detect doublets (technical errors) in single-cell RNA-seq count matrices.
DoubletFinder is an R package that predicts doublets in single-cell RNA sequencing data.
Computational identification of differentiation bias and genes underlaying cell type conversions
Our DPT software implementations make it possible to reconstruct the developmental progression of cells and identify transient or metastable states, branching decisions and differentiation endpoints.
A deep adversarial variational autoencoder model for dimensionality reduction in single-cell RNA sequencing analysis
DrImpute is an R package for imputing dropout events in single-cell RNA-sequencing data.
DrivAER: Identification of Driving transcriptional programs using AutoEncoder based Relevance scores
It offers a quick and straightfoward way to explore and perform basic analysis of single cell sequencing data coming from droplet sequencing, such as Drop-seq.
Efficient clustering of ultra-large scRNA-seq data
Pipeline for estimating molecular count matrices for droplet-based single-cell RNA-seq measurements.
Dropout Lasso, a robust variant of Lasso for data with dropout.
Package for handling droplet-based single-cell RNA-seq data

This pipeline is based on snakemake and the dropseq tools provided by the McCarroll Lab. It allows to go from raw data of your dropSeq/scrbSeq experiment until the final count matrix with QC plots along the way.
This is an R package for quickly simulating single cell RNAseq read count data.
Quality control and analysis pipeline for parallel single cell transcriptome and epigenome data
Transcriptional heterogeneity analysis for time-series single-cell RNA-seq data
Dune is an R Package that provides a parameter-free method for optimizing the trade-off between the resolution of clusters and their replicability across datasets
Deep Unsupervised Single-cell Clustering (DUSC) is a hybrid approach for cell type discovery in scRNA-seq data.
Dynamo: Mapping Vector Field of Single Cells
A toolkit for generating synthetic single cell data

dynverse is a collection of R packages aimed at supporting the trajectory inference (TI) community on multiple levels: end-users who want to apply TI on their dataset of interest, and developers who seek to easily quantify the performance of their TI method and compare it to other TI methods.
ECLAIR stands for Ensemble Clustering for Lineage Analysis, Inference and Robustness. Robust and scalable inference of cell lineages from gene expression data.
Elastic Coupled Co-clustering for Single-Cell Genomic Data
Ensemble Learning for classifying Single-cell data and projection across reference Atlases

Embeddr creates a reduced dimensional representation of the gene space using a high-variance gene correlation graph and laplacian eigenmaps. It then fits a smooth pseudotime trajectory using principal curves.
Single-Cell RNA-seq Data using Evolutionary Multiobjective Ensemble Pruning
Accurate denoising of single-cell RNA-Seq data using unbiased principal component analysis
Imputing dropout events in single cell RNA sequencing data via ensemble learning
An Unsupervised Ensemble Learning Method for Quality Control of Single Cell RNA-seq Sequencing Data

The ESAT toolkit is designed for expression analysis of Digital expression (DGE) libraries that target transcript "ends". ESAT takes a set of alignment files (SAM or BAM) with genome alignment coordinates, a file containing transcript coordinates (BED or text file) and outputs read counts for each transcript provided.
A Cloud-based Genetic Feature Quantification Analysis Tool

Here we present FastProject, a software package for two-dimensional visualization of single cell data, which utilizes a plethora of projection methods and provides a way to systematically investigate the biological relevance of these low dimensional representations by incorporating domain knowledge.
FateID is a random forests-based algorithm for the quantification of the fate biases of multipotent progenitors, i. e. the probabilities of differentiating towards particular cell lineages.
The fcoex package implements an easy-to use interface to co-expression analysis based on the FCBF (Fast Correlation-Based Filter) algorithm.
FiRE - Finder of Rare Entities
Fishpond: differential transcript and gene expression with inferential replicates
Reproducible machine learning analysis of gene expression and alternative splicing data
Graph-based visualizations of high-dimensional single-cell data across time
Finding Orderings Robustly using K-means and Steiner trees (FORKS), an algorithm that pseudo-temporally orders cells and thereby infers bifurcating state trajectories.
G2S3: a Sparse and Smooth Signal of Gene Graph-based imputation method for scRNA-seq data

Garnett, an algorithm and accompanying software for rapidly annotating cell types in scRNA-seq and scATAC-seq datasets, based on an interpretable, hierarchical markup language of cell type-specific genes.
Interactive notebook workflow for pre-processing data, identification of sub-populations of cells by clustering, and exploration of biomarkers.

genesorteR is an R package for single cell data analysis. It calculates a specificity score to rank all genes in each cell cluster. It can then use this ranking to find sets of marker genes or to find highly variable genes.
The goal of GeneSwitches is to discover the order of gene-expression and functional events during cell state transitions at a single-cell resolution.
geosketch is a Python package that implements the geometric sketching algorithm for subsampling cells
An R implementation of the Gene Frequency - Inverse Cell Frequency method for single cell data normalization
GiniClust is a clustering method implemented in Python and R for detecting rare cell-types from large-scale single-cell gene expression data.
GiniClust2 is a clustering algorithm for the simultaneous detection of common and rare cell types from single-cell gene expression data.

GiniClust is a clustering method specifically designed for rare cell type detection. In this new version (GiniClust3), we have substantially increased the speed and reduced memory usage in order to meet the need for large data size.
Implements a generalized version of principal components analysis (GLM-PCA) for dimension reduction of non-normally distributed data such as counts or binary matrices.
GMM-Demux removes Multi-Sample-Multiplets (MSMs) in a cell hashing dataset and estimates the fraction of Same-Sample-Multiplets (SSMs) and singlets in the remaining dataset.
Model transcriptional cell fates as mixtures of Gaussian Processes
GPseudoClust: deconvolution of shared pseudo-trajectories at single-cell resolution
GPseudoRank, an algorithm sampling from a posterior distribution of pseudo-orders instead of pseudotimes, avoiding the exploration of pseudotime assignments that all map to the same ordering.
This is a graphical single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) analysis pipeline for genomics scientists.
GrandPrix is a python package implementing the approach described in the paper "GrandPrix: Scaling up the Bayesian GPLVM for single-cell data" .
Compute a 2D embedding of a data matrix given supervised class information
Imputing Single-cell RNA-seq data by combining Graph Convolution and Autoencoder Neural Networks
Gene Regulation Inference for Single-cell with LInear differential equations and velocity inference
Normalization and noise reduction for singlecell RNA-seq experiments
Gene Regulatory Network reconstruction using Unrolled algorithms

Gene Regulatory Network (GRN) inference from time series or pseudo-time series data using a first-order autoregressive moving average (AR1MA1) model within a variational Bayesian Expectation-Maximization (VBEM) framework.
Algorithm that projects cells into a shared embedding in which cells group by cell type rather than dataset-specific conditions.
Single cell UMI analysis tool that focuses on zero-inflation to detect biological heterogeneity.
Basic PCA-based workflow for analysis and plotting of single cell RNA-seq data.
hidden Markov model integrated Bayesian approach for detecting CNV and LOH events from single-cell RNA-seq data
Single-cell pseudotime recovery using continuous Hopfield network based modeling of Waddingtons epigenetic landscape
Hopper is a mathematically motivated sketching algorithm for single-cell data, which preserves transcriptional diversity using a farthest-first traversal on the data.
Hotspot is a tool for identifying informative genes (and gene modules) in a single-cell dataset
A hierarchical progressive learning method which automatically finds relationships between cell populations across multiple datasets and uses this to construct a hierarchical classification tree
A method for identifying haematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) in scRNA-seq data
Estimation and sampling of high-dimensional undirected co-expression networks for single cell RNAseq experiments.  Based on a multivariate Normal hurdle model.
hypercluster, a python package and SnakeMake pipeline for flexible and parallelized clustering evaluation and selection
I-Impute: a coherent strategy to impute single-cell RNA sequencing data

Iteratively Adjusted Surrogate Variable Analysis (IA-SVA) is a statistical framework to uncover hidden sources of variation even when these sources are correlated with the biological variable of interest.
iCellR is an interactive R package to work with high-throughput single cell sequencing technologies (i.e scRNA-seq, scVDJ-seq and CITE-seq)
Integrative Differential expression and gene set Enrichment Analysis using summary statistics for single cell RNA-seq studies
IKAP  Identifying K mAjor cell Population groups in single-cell RNA-seq analysis

ILoReg is a tool for high-resolution cell population identification from single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data. High-resolution refers to the ability of ILoReg to identify subpopulations with subtle transcriptomic differences.
Knowledge-based and lineage-driven immune cell classification in single-cell RNA-Seq data

With this package .fsa intensity files or files with sequencing lengths representing the CDR3 region of T-cell receptors can be loaded, visualized and scored for quantification of the immune repertoire.
indeXplorer is a web-based App written with shiny for the explorative analysis of index-sorted, single-cell transcriptomic data.
Infer Copy Number Variation using Single-cell RNA-Seq Expression Data.
Processes GoT amplicon data and generates a table of metrics
iS-CellR (Interactive platform for Single-cell RNAseq) is a web-based Shiny application designed to provide a comprehensive analysis of single-cell RNA sequencing data.
Iscandar (Interactive Single Cell Data Analysis Report) is a set of python scripts and html/javascript files used to create interactive report for single cell rna-seq analysis.

The SummarizedExplorer package aims to provide an interactive user interface for exploring data in SummarizedExperiment objects. Particular focus will be given to single-cell data in the SingleCellExperiment derived class.
ISOform-level expression Patterns in single-cell RNA-sequencing data.
iTALK is an R toolkit for characterizing and illustrating intercellular communication
ItClust is an Iterative Transfer learning algorithm for scRNA-seq clustering

iterClust, an iterative clustering framework, which can separate more pronounced differences (e.g. A and B) in starting iterations, followed by relatively subtle differences (e.g. B1 and B2), providing a comprehensive clustering trajectory.

ivis preserves global data structures in a low-dimensional space, adds new data points to existing embeddings using a parametric mapping function, and scales linearly to hundreds of thousands of cells
The jackstraw package provides a statistical test to identify variables (i.e., transcripts, genes) or observations (i.e., single cells) that are significantly associated with latent variables.
The main idea behind the K-Branches method is to identify regions of interest (branching regions and tips) in differentiation trajectories of single cells.
kallisto produces transcript-level quantification estimates for RNA-seq data. It can produce transript compatibility count estimates for scRNA-seq data.
An R package to provide a test for batch effects in high-dimensional single-cell RNA sequencing data.

Smoothing is performed by first identifying the nearest neighbors of each cell in a step-wise fashion, based on variance-stabilized and partially smoothed expression profiles, and then aggregating their transcript counts.
Knowledge-primed neural networks enable biologically interpretable deep learning on single-cell sequencing data
LAmbDA is an algorithm that assigns unknown labels to datasets and trains on those labels across multiple datasets.
LandSCENT (Landscape Single Cell Entropy) is a R-package for the analysis of single-cell RNA-Seq data
LATE leverages information of dependence between genes/cells, and recovers the missing values (zeros)
Constructing Gene Co-Expression Networks for Single-Cell RNA-Sequencing Data Using Pseudotime Ordering.
LIGER (Linked Inference of Genomic Experimental Relationships)
Differential expression analysis and model fitting for single-cell RNA-seq data in pseudotime
Linnorm is an R package for the analysis of RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, ChIP-seq count data or any large scale count data.

LTMGSCA is a left truncated mixture Gaussian (LTMG) model-based single cell RNA-seq analysis pipeline that can accurately infer the modality and distribution of individual genes expression profile in scRNA-seq data, while decrease the impact from dropout and low expression value.
R package providing functions for fitting a modified Michaelis-Menten (MM) equation to the pattern of dropouts observed in a single-cell sequencing experiment.
M3S: a comprehensive model selection for multi-modal single-cell RNA sequencing data
Markov Affinity-based Graph Imputation of Cells (MAGIC)
MAPiT: measure-preserving MAP of pseudotime into true Time
A meta-learning approach for cell type discovery in heterogenous single-cell data
Model-based Analysis of Single-cell Transcriptomics (MAST) fits a two-part, generalized linear models that are specially adapted for bimodal and/or zero-inflated single cell gene expression data.
Manifold Alignment to Characterize Experimental Relationships (MATCHER)
matchSCore is a easy-to-use R package for the comparison of single cell RNA-seq data across tools and experiments
MatchSCore2 is a R package for the comparison of single cell RNA-seq data across tools and experiments.
Implements the mini-batch k-means algorithm for large datasets, including support for on-disk data representation.
mcap provides a model-based clustering approach in very high dimensions (especially when p is much larger than n) via adaptive projections.
A matlab tool for imputation of scRNA-seq data

MCA is a dimensionality reduction technique that allows the representation of both individuals (cells) and the variables (genes) within the same Euclidean space, thus allowing the simultaneous identification of subpopulations of cells and their gene signatures.
This package performs lineage tracing using copy number profile from single cell sequencing technology
MELD (Manifold Enhancement of Latent Dimensions), Quantifying the effect of experimental perturbations in scRNA-seq data.
MERLot is a tool that can reconstruct the lineage tree topology that explains the emergence of different cell types from a progenitor population.

The MetaCell R package facilitates analysis of single cell RNA-seq UMI matrices by computing partitions of a cell similarity graph into small (~20-200 typically) homogeneous groups of cells which are defined as metacells (MCs).
MetaNeighbor: a method to rapidly assess cell type identity using both functional and random gene sets
mfa is an R package implementing Gibbs sampling for a Bayesian hierarchichal mixture of factor analysers for inference of bifurcations in single-cell data.
A package for marker gene detection
Marker gene Identification for Cell Type Identity
Millefy is a tool for visualizing read coverage of single-cell RNA sequensing (scRNA-seq) datasets in genomic contexts.
Multiple Input Multiple Output Single Cell Analysis
A comprehensive sequence-level droplet-based single-cell RNA-seq (dscRNA-seq) experiment simulation framework
mitch is an R package for multi-dimensional enrichment analysis
Python implementation of the MNN batch correction algorithm
Moana (Multi-resolution transcriptOmic ANAlysis framework): Robust cell type classification of single-cell RNA-Seq data
MOFA is a factor analysis model that provides a general framework for the integration of multi-omic data sets in a completely unsupervised fashion.
MOFA is a factor analysis model that provides a general framework for the integration of multi-omic data sets in an unsupervised fashion.
Differential expression and time-series analysis for single-cell RNA-Seq.
Mpath: an algorithm for constructing multi-branching cell lineages from single-cell data
modified probabilistic count matrix factorization (m-pCMF)
MPSSC is a novel spectral clustering framework that imposes sparse structures on a target matrix.
MTGO-SC is an adaptation for single cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) of MTGO, a biological network module detection algorithm.
Multi-sample Unified Discriminant ANalysis
Multi-sample multi-group scRNA-seq analysis tools
MuSiC is a deconvolution method that utilizes cross-subject scRNA-seq to estimate cell type proportions in bulk RNA-seq data.
MUSIC: Model-based Understanding of SIngle-cell CRISPR screening
This repository contains a collection of tools for analyzing RNA 5 end data from nanoPARE sequencing libraries.
Negative binomial with independent dispersions (NBID) for UMI based scRNA-seq data
netNMF-sc: A network regularization algorithm for dimensionality reduction and imputation of single-cell expression data
A Network smoothing based method for single cell RNA-seq
net-SNE, a neural network-based visualization tool developed for single cell RNA sequencing datasets.
NetworkInference is a package for inferring (undirected) networks, given a set of measurements for each node.
NicheNet uses human or mouse gene expression data of interacting cells as input and combines this with a prior model that integrates existing knowledge on ligand-to-target signaling paths.

Non-negative Independent Factor Analysis (NIFA) simultaneously models uni- and multi-modal latent factors and can so isolate discrete cell-type identity and continuous pathway-level variations into separate components
Nimfa is a Python module that implements many algorithms for nonnegative matrix factorization

northstar is a Python package to identify cell types within single cell transcriptomics datasets. northstar's superpower is that it learns from cell atlases but still allows queer cells to make their own cluster if they want to.
A NMF-based approach to discover overlooked differentially expressed gene regions from single-cell RNA-seq data
Identify ordering effect genes in single cell RNA-seq data. OEFinder shiny impelemention depends on packages shiny, shinyFiles, gdata, and EBSeq.
Performs optimized gene filtering for single-cell RNA-seq data
OnClass is a python package for single-cell cell type annotation. It uses the Cell Ontology to capture the cell type similarity.
OnlinePCA.jl binarizes a CSV file, summarizes the data matrix and performs online-PCA functions for extremely large scale matrices
Oscope: a statistical pipeline for identifying oscillatory genes in unsynchronized single cell RNA-seq experiments.
Incorporate prior information into single-cell trajectory (pseudotime) analyses using Bayesian nonlinear factor analysis.

ouijaflow implements the probabilistic single-cell pseudotime model Ouija in Edward and Tensorflow, allowing scalable inference on large single-cell datasets. Inference is performed using reparametrization gradient variational inference.

Outrigger is a program to calculate alternative splicing scores of RNA-Seq data based on junction reads and a de novo, custom annotation created with a graph database, especially made for single-cell analyses.
Single Cell Analysis and Differential Expression

Palantir is an algorithm to align cells along differentiation trajectories. Palantir models differentiation as a stochastic process where stem cells differentiate to terminally differentiated cells by a series of steps through a low dimensional phenotypic manifold.
Parallelized Inference for Single Cell Transcriptomic Clustering with Split Merge Sampling on DPMM Model

PARC, phenotyping by accelerated refined community-partitioning - is a fast, automated, combinatorial graph-based clustering approach that integrates hierarchical graph construction (HNSW) and data-driven graph-pruning with the new Leiden community-detection algorithm.
Population balance analysis (PBA) relates the observed states of a system to its steady-state dynamics by applying the law of population balance.
PBLR: an accurate single cell RNA-seq data imputation tool considering cell heterogeneity and prior expression level of dropouts
Hierarchical clustering of single cell transcriptional profiles
A probabilistic Count Matrix Factorization (pCMF) approach for single-cell expression data analysis, that relies on a sparse Gamma-Poisson factor model.

The term creode was coined by C.H. Waddington, combining the Greek words for necessary and path to describe the cell state transitional trajectories that define cell fate specification. Our algorithm aims to identify consensus routes from relatively noisy single-cell data and thus we named this algorithm p- (putative) Creode.
peco is an R package for predicting cell cycle progression in a continnum using scRNA-seq data.
PHATE is a tool for visualizing high dimensional single-cell data with natural progressions or trajectories.

PhenoPath learns genomic trajectories (pseudotimes) in the presence of heterogenous environmental and genetic backgrounds encoded as additional covariates and identifies interactions between the trajectories and covariates.
Probabilistic index models for testing differential expression in gene expression data
pipeComp is a simple framework to facilitate the comparison of pipelines involving various steps and parameters
PIVOT facilitates fast and interactive RNA-Seq data analysis and visualization.

R package providing functions for fitting, analyzing and visualizing single-cell RNASeq data which has been quantified by counting UMIs while accounting for different sequencing depths/detection rates between cells.
polyApipe is a pipeline for examining Alternative PolyAdenylation (APA) from 10X Genomics single-cell RNA Sequencing
Power analysis for bulk and single cell RNA-seq experiments
Cell-Cycle Phase Detector for scRNA-seq
PROSSTT (PRObabilistic Simulations of ScRNA-seq Tree-like Topologies) is a package with code for the simulation of scRNAseq data for dynamic processes such as cell differentiation.
Infer kinetics from scRNA-seq/feature barcoding data
Pseudodynamics provides a dynamic (time resolved) description of a population as a density over a cell state coordinate.
pseudogp is an R package for Bayesian inference of Gaussian Process Latent Variable models learning pseudotimes from single-cell RNA-seq.

pyHSICLasso is a package of the Hilbert Schmidt Independence Criterion Lasso (HSIC Lasso), which is a black box (nonlinear) feature selection method considering the nonlinear input and output relationship.
PyMINEr automates advanced scRNA-seq analyses without coding
Python implementation of NVR (neighborhood variance ratio) gene selection to select genes with local and monotonic variation
Quasildr is a python library for quasilinear data representation methods
QUBIC2 is a novel biclustering algorithm for analyses of gene expression data from bulk and single-cell RNA-Sequencing.

RaceID is a clustering algorithm for the identification of cell types from single-cell RNA-sequencing data. It was specifically designed for the detection of rare cells which correspond to outliers in conventional clustering methods.
Implements a two-step procedure using feature construction and random forest based similarity learning for single cell RNA sequencing data.

RayleighSelection is an R package for feature selection in topological spaces. Features are defined as differential forms on a simplicial complex and their significance is assesed through Rayleigh quotients.
RCA, short for Reference Component Analysis, is an R package for robust clustering analysis of single cell RNA sequencing data (scRNAseq).
rCASC, Cluster Analysis of Single Cells
reCAT is a modelling framework for unsynchronized single-cell transcriptome data that can reconstruct a high-resolution cell cycle time-series.
Red Panda employs the unique information found in scRNA-seq to increase accuracy of variant detection compared to software designed for bulk sequencing.
redPATH formulates the problem of pseudo temporal ordering into a Hamiltonian path problem and attempts to recover the pseudo development time in single-cell RNA-seq datasets
Bootstrap imputation for scRNAseq data
robustSingleCell is a pipeline designed to identify robust cell subpopulations using scRNAseq data and compare population compositions across tissues and experimental models via similarity analysis
ROGUE: an entropy-based universal metric for assessing the purity of single cell population
ROSeq evaluates differential expression between two subpopulations of single cells by modeling the rank distribution of read counts for each gene
RobustPCA: Decompose a Matrix into Low-Rank and Sparse Components, Truncated RobustPCA with L2 noise.
RSCORE is an R package to explore single-cell RNA-seq data with the view of molecular networks
Alignment, quantification and analysis of second and third generation sequencing data
SAFE (Single-cell Aggregated clustering From Ensemble): Cluster ensemble for single-cell RNA-seq data
Single cell RNA-seq analysis with iterative clustering (SAIC) is a method to identify subgroups and signature genes in single cell RNA-seq data.
Single-cell RNA-Seq Analysis and Klustering Evaluation. The aim of sake is to provide a user-friendly tool for easy analysis of NGS Single-Cell transcriptomic data.
Salmon produces transcript-level quantification estimates for RNA-seq data. It includes the Alevin pipeline for quantifying droplet scRNA-seq.
The self-assembling manifold (SAM) algorithm, an iterative soft feature selection strategy to quantify gene relevance and improve dimensionality reduction.
Statistical test for differential expression in single-celltranscriptome with spike-in normalization
Sampling Noise based Inference of Transcription ActivitY : Filtering of Poison noise on a single-cell RNA-seq UMI count matrix

SAUCIE (Sparse Autoencoder for Unsupervised Clustering, Imputation, and Embedding), simultaneously performs several key tasks for single-cell data analysis including 1) clustering, 2) batch correction, 3) visualization, and 4) denoising/imputation.

SAVER (Single-cell Analysis Via Expression Recovery) implements a regularized regression prediction and empirical Bayes method to recover the true gene expression profile in noisy and sparse single-cell RNA-seq data.
R package for transfer learning of scRNA-seq denoising.
Implements the sparse Bayesian dynamic network model

SC2P provides functionalities for testing DE in two phases: (1) phase transition (difference in the probabilities of being expressed); and (2) magnitude tuning (difference in the levels of expression once the gene is on).
SC3 is an interactive tool for the unsupervised clustering of cells from single cell RNA-Seq experiments.
Model-based approach to the joint analysis of single-cell data on chromatin accessibility and gene expression
scAEspy: a unifying tool based on autoencoders for the analysis of single-cell RNA sequencing data
scAI: a single cell Aggregation and Integration method for analyzing single cell multi-omics data
Allele-Specific Expression by Single-Cell RNA Sequencing
A deep learning method for aligning and integrating scRNA-seq data collected across multiple conditions into a common, low-dimensional cell state space for downstream analysis
Calculate allele-specific count tables
Scanorama enables batch-correction and integration of heterogeneous scRNA-seq datasets
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data.
This is a package and a shell script for alternative polyadenylation (APA) analysis of 3' tag single-cell RNA-seq data.

Scater places an emphasis on tools for quality control, visualisation and pre-processing of data before further downstream analysis, filling a useful niche between raw RNA-sequencing count or transcripts-per-million data and more focused downstream modelling tools such as monocle, scLVM, SCDE, edgeR, limma and so on.
A statistical tool to detect differential alternative splicing events using single-cell RNA-seq
scBASE is a python implementation of three-component Beta-Binomial mixture model for accurate quantitation of allele-specific expression (ASE) from scRNA-Seq data.
Batch Effect Correction of RNA-seq Data through Sample Distance Matrix Adjustment
scBio: Single Cell Genomics for Enhancing Cell Composition Inference from Bulk Genomics Data
scRNA-seq complementation (SCC) can recover the gene expression of scRNA-seq data
Single Cell Clustering Assessment Framework (SCCAF) is a novel method for automated identification of putative cell types from single cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data

The scCancer package focuses on processing and analyzing droplet-based scRNA-seq data for cancer research. Except basic data processing steps, this package takes several special considerations for cancer-specific features.
Automatic Annotation on Cell Types of Clusters from Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Data
CB2 is a cluster-based approach for distinguishing true cells from background barcodes in droplet-based single cell RNA-seq experiments
single-cell Consensus Clusters of Encoded Subspaces
Single cell classification via cell-type hierarchies based on ensemble learning and sample size estimation.
Perform clustering on single-cell RNA-sequencing data with different similarity metrics on k-means and SIMLR clustering methods.
The goal of scclusteval (Single Cell Cluster Evaluation) is to evaluate single cell clustering stability by boostrapping/subsampling cells and providing visualization methods for comparing clusters.
An interactive R Shiny tool for visualizing single-cell RNAseq clustering results from the Seurat R package or any other analysis pipeline.
An approach combining semi-supervised and unsupervised clustering for cell type annotation in single-cell RNA-seq data
scDAPA - a tool for detection and visualization of dynamic alternative polyadenylation from scRNA-seq dataq
scDataviz: single cell dataviz and downstream analyses
SCDC: Deconvolution of Bulk Gene Expression by Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Data

scDD (Single-Cell Differential Distributions) is a framework to identify genes with different expression patterns between biological groups of interest. In addition to traditional differential expression, it can detect differences that are more complex and subtle than a mean shift.
Identifying differential distributed genes for single cell RNA data
Differential expression using error models and overdispersion-based identification of important gene sets.
scDeepCluster, a model-based deep embedded clustering for Single Cell RNA-seq data.
scDesign: a statistical simulator for rational scRNA-seq experimental design
Supervised Adversarial Alignment of scRNA-seq Data
SCDIFF is a python package designed to analyze the cell differentiation process using time-series single cell RNA-seq data.
scdNet: a computational tool for single-cell differential network analysis
scdney is a R package with collection of single cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) data analysis functions
Single-Cell RNA-seq Drop-Out Correction (scDoc)
single cell doublet scoring: In-silico doublet annotation for single cell RNA sequencing data
Empirical Bayes estimators for single-cell RNA-Seq analysis

Scedar (Single-cell exploratory data analysis for RNA-Seq) is a reliable and easy-to-use Python package for efficient visualization, imputation of gene dropouts, detection of rare transcriptomic profiles, and clustering of large-scale single cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) datasets.

SCell is an integrated software tool for quality filtering, normalization, feature selection, iterative dimensionality reduction, clustering and the estimation of gene-expression gradients from large ensembles of single-cell RNA-seq datasets. SCell is open source, and implemented with an intuitive graphical interface.
SCelVis: Easy Single-Cell Visualization
SCENIC is a tool to infer Gene Regulatory Networks and cell types from single-cell RNA-seq data.
scent is an R-package for analysis of single-cell RNA-Seq data. It uses single-cell entropy to help analyse and interpret such data.

scEpath is a novel computational method for quantitatively measuring developmental potency and plasticity of single cells and transition probabilities between cell states, and inferring lineage relationships and pseudotemporal ordering from single-cell gene expression data.
scFBA is a suite of MATLAB functions to perform a single-cell Flux Balance Analysis (scFBA).
An R package to set thresholds for feature (gene, transcript, ...) filtering in single cell RNA sequencing analyses
scfind - Fast searches of large collections of single cell data
Realistic in silico generation and augmentation of single cell RNA-seq data using Generative Adversarial Neural Networks
Matlab App for Single-cell Gene Expression Analysis including feature selection
scGen is a generative model to predict single-cell perturbation response across cell types, studies and species
cGeneFit, selects gene transcript markers that jointly optimize cell label recovery using label-aware compressive classification methods

This Docker image processes GESTALT barcode sequencing data. Reads are merged by UMI, aligned to the reference file, and aggregated into plots describing the overall editing, as well as trees describing the relative lineage relationships within your data.
A complete single cell RNA analysis framework to decompose a mixed population into clusters (SCORE) and to analyse the relationship between clusters (scGPS).
The goal of schex is to provide easy plotting of hexagon cell representations of single cell data stored in SingleCellExperiment or Seurat objects
Imputing dropout events for single-cell RNA-seq data with limited sample size
SCHiRM: Single Cell Hierarchical Regression Model to detect dependencies in read count data

scHLAcount allows you to count molecules in single-cell RNA-seq data for class I genes HLA-A, B, and C; and class II genes DPA1, DPB1, DRA1, DRB1, DQA1, and DQB1 using a personalized reference genome.
Shiny app for the exploration and analysis of single cell RNAseq data as it comes from 10X or MARSseq technologies.
Scalable Clustering of Hierarchical Stochastic Neighbour Embedding hierarchies using Louvain community detection
Single cell Higher Order Testing (scHOT) is an R package that facilitates testing changes in higher order structure of gene expression along either a developmental trajectory or across space
scHPF is a tool for de novo discovery of both discrete and continuous expression patterns in single-cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) data.
Single Cell Iterative Clustering and Significance Testing
scID is a method for geneset-guided identification of cell types at the level of individual cells, using single cell RNA-seq data.
scIGANs is a computational tool for single-cell RNA-seq imputation and denoise using Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
SCIMITAR provides a variety of tools to analyze trajectory maps of single-cell measurements.
scImpute is developed to accurately and robustly impute the dropout values in scRNA-seq data
SCINA is an automatic cell type detection and assignment algorithm for single cell RNA-Seq (scRNA-seq) and Cytof/FACS data.
This method computes a distribution over edges of a scaffold network and allows to perform differential network analysis
Scirpy is a scalable python-toolkit to analyze T cell receptor (TCR) repertoires from single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data
scIVA - Single Cell Interactive Visualisation and Analysis
A Robust and Scalable Algorithm to Reveal Subtle Diversity in Large-Scale Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data
Tracing lineage of single cells via genetic variants based on a Bayesian Hierarchical model

scLVM is a modelling framework for single-cell RNA-seq data that can be used to dissect the observed heterogeneity into different sources, thereby allowing for the correction of confounding sources of variation. scLVM was primarily designed to account for cell-cycle induced variations in single-cell RNA-seq data where cell cycle is the primary soure of variability.
scMAGeCK is a computational model to identify genes associated with multiple expression phenotypes from CRISPR screening coupled with single-cell RNA sequencing data (CROP-seq)
scmap is a method for projecting cells from a scRNA-seq experiment on to the cell-types identified in a different experiment.
Single-cell mapper (scMappR) is an R package that allows users to better understand the cell-type contributions to a list of genes

SCMarker is a R package that performs ab initio marker selection from single cell RNA sequencing data to enhance downstream cell-type clustering, trajectory inference and cell-type specific biological analysis.
scMatch directly annotates single cells by identifying their closest match in large reference datasets
Accurately defines cell types based on single-cell digital expression.
scMerge removes unwanted variation by combining stably expressed genes and utilizing pseudo-replicates across datasets

scMetric is an R package that applies a metric learning algorithm to scRNA-seq data. It allows users to give example samples to specify expected angles they would use to analyze the data, and the package learns the metric from the examples and applies the metric for downstream clustering and visualization.
Fitting Discrete Distribution Models to Count Data
SCmut is a novel and robust statistical method for cell-level somatic mutation detection from single-cell RNA-sequencing
A fast and efficient count-based matrix factorization method for detecting cell types from single-cell RNA-seq data
scNCA is an R package for integrating multiple sources of temporal single cell RNA-seq data
A quantile regression based approach for robust normalization of single cell RNA-seq data.
An integrative framework assisted by network propagation and network fusion for pre-processing of single-cell RNA-seq data
The Single Cell Network Synthesis tool (SCNS) is a tool for the reconstruction and analysis of executable models from single-cell gene expression data.
SCODE : an efficient regulatory network inference algorithm from single-cell RNA-Seq during differentiation.

SCONE (Single-Cell Overview of Normalized Expression), a package for single-cell RNA-seq data quality control (QC) and normalization. This data-driven framework uses summaries of expression data to assess the efficacy of normalization workflows.
SCope: Visualization of large-scale and high dimensional single cell data
SCORPIUS an unsupervised approach for inferring developmental chronologies from single-cell RNA sequencing data.
Uses probabilistic model based on the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process to analyze single-cell expression data during differentiation.
Inference of single-cell pseudo-time ordering with bifurcation trajectories

PanoView is an iterative PCA-based method that integrates with a novel density-based clustering, ordering local maximum by convex hull (OLMC) algorithm, to identify cell subpopulations for single-cell RNA-sequencing.
A statistical approach to identify and classify expression changes in single cell RNA-seq experiments with ordered conditions.

The scPCA package implements sparse constrastive PCA, to accomplish both of these tasks in the context of high-dimensional biological data. In addition to implementing this newly developed technique, the scPCA package also implements cPCA and generalizations thereof.
scphaser is an R package for haplotype phasing using single-cell RNA-seq data.
ScPhere resolves cell crowding, corrects multiple, complex batch factors, facilitates interactive visualization of large datasets, and gracefully uncovers pseudotemporal trajectories.
a pipeline for single cell RNA-seq data analysis

To detect aneuploidies from scRNA-sequencing data we computed, for a defined group of cells, a score for each chromosome-cell pair that measures whether the expression level of genes in that chromosome differs substantially from other cells.
Single cell interactive plotting tools
A python tool to do comparative analysis of mulitple single cell RNA-seq datasets.
scPower is a R package for design and power analysis of cell type specific interindividual DE and eQTL studies using single cell RNA-seq
Single cell prediction using singular value decomposition and machine learning classification
scprep provides an all-in-one framework for loading, preprocessing, and plotting matrices in Python, with a focus on single-cell genomics
Single Cell Sequencing Data Quality Control
Single Cell RNA-Seq imputAtion constrained By BuLk RNAsEq data (SCRABBLE)

This package implements a variety of low-level analyses of single-cell RNA-seq data. Methods are provided for normalization of cell-specific biases, pool-based norms to estimate size factors, assignment of cell cycle phase, and detection of highly variable and significantly correlated genes.
Single Cell R Analysis Toolkit
An unsupervised method that identifies stable cell states and transition cells by adopting a nonlinear optimization model that infers the latent substructures from a gene-cell matrix.
Post hoc cell type classification of single-cell RNA-sequencing data

scRecover is an R package for imputation of single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data. It will detect and impute dropout values in a scRNA-seq raw read counts matrix while keeping the real zeros unchanged.
scREhurdle is an R package for detecting differentially expressed genes in discrete single-cell RNA sequencing data
A toolkit for detecting and visualizing causal regulations
This is the SCRL toolkit developed for learning meaningful representations for scRNA-seq data by integrating multiple source of network information.
scRMD: Imputation for single cell RNA-seq data via restricted robust matrix decomposition
scRNA - Transfer learning for clustering single-cell RNA-Seq data
scRNABatchQC is an R package for generating a HTML QC report to check and compare quality of multiple single cell RNA-seq datasets
scRNAss: a single-cell RNA-seq assembler via imputing dropouts and combing junctions
Single-Cell Remover of Doublets. Python code for identifying doublets in single-cell RNA-seq data.
scruff (Single Cell RNA-Seq UMI Filtering Facilitator) is a package for processing single cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) FASTQ reads generated by CEL-Seq and CEL-Seq2 protocols.
scRutiNy is comprised of two modules: RNAscrutiny.MatriSeq for simulation and RNAscrutiny.RegNetInference for inferring gene networks
A collection of methods for the analysis of small-count data, such as single-cell RNA-seq
An automatic tool to annotate cell types from single-cell RNA-seq data, based on a score annotation model combining differentially expressed genes and confidence levels of cell markers in databases

scScope is a deep-learning based approach that can accurately and rapidly identify cell-type composition and transcriptional state from noisy single-cell gene-expression profiles containing dropout events and scale to millions of cells.
scSeqR (Single Cell Sequencing R package) is an interactive R package to works with high-throughput single cell sequencing technologies (i.e scRNA-seq, scVDJ-seq and CITE-seq).
Simulate single-cell RNA-SEQ data using the Splatter statistical framework but implemented in python.
Genotype-free demultiplexing of pooled single-cell RNAseq, using a hidden state model for identifying genetically distinct samples within a mixed population
An R package for interactive two- and three-dimensional visualization and exploration of massive single-cell omics data.
This project is an implementation of a pipeline for Single-cell RNAseq package for recovering TCR data in python.

scTDA is an object oriented python library for topological data analysis of high-throughput single-cell RNA-seq data. It includes tools for the preprocessing, analysis, and exploration of single-cell RNA-seq data based on topological representations.
Compare single-cell gene regulatory networks (scGRNs) using single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data collected from different conditions
Detection of cell-cell interaction within single-cell RNA-Seq data
Quality control and cell type annotation for unannotated single-cell RNA-Seq data
Indentification of  significantly activated ligand-receptor interactions across clusters of cells from single-cell RNA sequencing data
Seeking Cell-Type-Indicative Marker from single cell RNA-seq data by consensus optimization
R package for modeling single cell UMI expression data using regularized negative binomial regression
scTSSR simultaneously leverages information from both similar genes and similar cells using a two-side sparse self-representation model to impute scRNA-seq data

SCUBA stands for "Single-cell Clustering Using Bifurcation Analysis." SCUBA is a novel computational method for extracting lineage relationships from single-cell gene expression data, and modeling the dynamic changes associated with cell differentiation.

scumi is a flexible Python package to process fastq files generated from different single-cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) protocols to produce a gene-cell sparse expression matrix for downstream analyses,

scUnifrac is a R package to quantify cell population diversity between two single-cell transcriptome profiles, which calculates the distance, estimates the statistical significance of the distance, identifies the subpopulations that are significant different between two profiles, finds genes that mark subpopulations, and predicts cell types of subpopulations.
scVAE: Single-cell variational auto-encoders
Multitask Clustering of scRNAseq Data
scVEGs is a novel algorithm for single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data to determine significant variably expressed genes (VEGs) using a gene expression variation model (GEVM).
scVelo is a scalable toolkit for estimating and analyzing RNA velocities in single cells using dynamical modeling.
Bayesian Inference for a Generative Model of Transcriptome Profiles from Single-cell RNA Sequencing
Single-Cell Virtual Cytometer is an open source software for straightforward visualization and exploration of multimodal single cell datasets as in flow cytometry.
scvis is a python package for dimension reduction of high-dimensional biological data, especially single-cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) data
SEGtool is an R package with self-adaptive function and high accuracy for specifically expressed gene (SEG, also known as tissue specific gene) detection.

SEPA provides convenient functions for users to assign genes into different gene expression patterns such as constant, monotone increasing and increasing then decreasing. SEPA then performs GO enrichment analysis to analysis the functional roles of genes with same or similar patterns.

SEPIRA includes SCIRA (Single Cell Inference of Regulatory Activity), which leverages the power of large-scale bulk RNA-Seq datasets to infer high-quality tissue-specific regulatory networks, from which regulatory activity estimates in single cells can be subsequently obtained.
This package will take real RNA-seq data (either single-cell or bulk) and alter it by adding signal to it.
SERGIO is a simulator for single-cell expression data guided by gene regulatory networks.

It contains easy-to-use implementations of commonly used analytical techniques, including the identification of highly variable genes, dimensionality reduction (PCA, ICA, t-SNE), standard unsupervised clustering algorithms (density clustering, hierarchical clustering, k-means), and the discovery of differentially expressed genes and markers.
R Shiny interface for Seurat v3 single-cell analysis library
R Shiny interface for Seurat single-cell analysis library
Single-cell RNA-seq Hyper-fast and Accurate processing via ensemble Random Projection
A versatile preprocessing pipeline designed to work with plate-based 3'-end protocols that include Unique Molecular Identifiers (UMIs)
SiCeLoRe (Single Cell Long Read) is a suite of tools dedicated to cell barcode / UMI assignment and bioinformatics analysis of highly multiplexed single cell Nanopore long read sequencing data.
Specific splice junction detection in single cells with SICILIAN (SIngle Cell precIse spLice estImAtioN)
Sierra is an R package designed for detecting differential transcript usage analysis from polyA-enriched single cell RNASeq data.
SigEMD is a novel method to identify differentially expressed genes in single cell RNA sequencing data.
A computational tool to predict hotspots of signaling pathways responsible for the stable maintenance of cell subpopulation phenotypes, by integrating signaling and transcriptional networks.
A versatile R package to facilitate the analysis workflow for single-cell data

Provides a general framework to perform statistical inference of each gene pair and global inference of whole-scale gene pairs in gene networks using the well known Gaussian graphical model (GGM) in a time-efficient manner.
SimiC models the GRN inference problem as a LASSO optimization problem with an added similarity constraint
Single-cell Interpretation via Multi-kernel LeaRning which learns an appropriate distance metric from the data for dimension reduction, clustering and visualization.
SIMPLEs: single-cell RNA sequencing imputation and cell clustering methods by modeling gene module variation
Implements Cluster Similarity Spectrum (CSS) integration where each cell is represented by its similarities to clusters independently identified across samples
SINC: a scale-invariant deep-neural-network classifier for bulk and single-cell RNA-seq data

Existing computational approaches for the assessment of cell-state hierarchies from single-cell data might be formalized under a general workflow composed of i) a metric to assess cell-to-cell similarities (combined or not with a dimensionality reduction step), and ii) a graph-building algorithm (optionally making use of a cells-clustering step). Sincell R package implements a methodological toolbox allowing flexible workflows under such framework.
R-based pipeline for single-cell analysis including clustering and visualization.
SINCERITIES is a tool for inferring gene regulatory networks from time-stamped cross-sectional single cell transcriptional expression profiles.
a MATLAB GUI toolbox for Single Cell Heterogeneity analysis in cancer
SINGE (Single-cell Inference of Networks using Granger Ensembles) reconstructs gene regulatory networks from pseudotime-annotated scRNA-seq data

Single Cell Explorer is a Python-based web server application for computational and experimental scientists to iteratively and collaboratively annotate cell expression phenotypes within a user-friendly and visually appealing platform.
singleCellHaystack is a package for finding surprising needles (=genes) in haystacks (=multi-dimensional representations of single cell transcriptome data)
SingleCellNet enables the classifcation of single cell RNA-Seq data across species and platforms
Allows single cell RNA seq data analysis, clustering, creates internal network and infers cell-cell interactions.
Single-Cell Signature Explorer is a package of four software tools dedicated to high throughput signature exploration in single-cell RNA-seq analysis.
Interactive Analysis of Single Cell RNA-Seq Data
SingleR leverages reference transcriptomic datasets of pure cell types to infer the cell of origin of each of the single cells independently
Algorithm for detecting alternative splicing in a population of single cells.
Single cell RNA-Seq analysis with quantitative phenotypes.
SinNLRR: a robust subspace clustering method for cell type detection by nonnegative and low rank representation
A Method and Tool to Control Single-cell RNA-seq Data Quality.
SIP is a single-cell data processing pipeline whose components are interchangeable.
Identify cell barcodes from single-cell genomics sequencing experiments
SemI-SUpervised generative Autoencoder (SISUA)
slalom is a scalable modelling framework for single-cell RNA-seq data that uses gene set annotations to dissect single-cell transcriptome heterogeneity.
Sleepwalk, a simple but powerful tool that allows the user to interactively explore an embedding

The SLICE (Single Cell Lineage Inference Using Cell Expression Similarity and Entropy) algorithm consists of two major steps: (1) measuring cell differentiation states based on the calculation of single cell entropy (scEntropy) and (2) predicting cell differentiation trajectories by ordering single cells according to their scEntropy-derived differentiation states.
Selective Locally linear Inference of Cellular Expression Relationships (SLICER) algorithm for inferring cell trajectories.
Functions for identifying and characterizing continuous developmental trajectories in single-cell sequencing data.
SMNN: Batch Effect Correction for Single-cell RNA-seq data via Supervised Mutual Nearest Neighbor Detection
SNN-Cliq is a clustering method designed for high dimensional gene expression data, e.g. single-cell transcriptome data.`
solo is a neural network framework to classify doublets, so that you can remove them from your data and clean your single cell profile.
SoptSC, a computational method for single cell data analysis.
SOUP, for Semi-sOft clUstering with Pure cells, is a clustering method for single cell data.
souporcell is a method for clustering mixed-genotype scRNAseq experiments by individual.
An R package for the estimation and removal of cell free mRNA contamination in droplet based single cell RNA-seq data.
Visualization and cellular hierarchy inference of single-cell data using SPADE.
A sparse differential clustering algorithm for tracing cell type changes via single-cell RNA-sequencing data
SPARSim is a single cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) count data simulator
Fast Adaptive Spectral Clustering for Single and Multi-View Data
Splatter is a package for the simple simulation of single-cell RNA-seq count data.
SPRING is a collection of pre-processing scripts and a web browser-based tool for visualizing and interacting with high dimensional data.
Semi-parametric simulation of bulk and single cell RNA-seq data

simpler single cell RNAseq data clustering (sscClust), is a package implement mutilple functionalities which are basic procedures in single cell RNAseq data analysis, including variable genes identification, dimension reduction, clustering on reduced data.
This procedure aims to fit sparse linear models using a binary matrix (n_samples x n_SNV) as features matrix and a gene expression matrix (n_genes x n_samples) as response.
STARsolo: mapping, demultiplexing and gene quantification for single cell RNA-seq
We first use hierarchical clustering to identify the most mature cell populations; we then use these populations as a training set to classify priming in the less mature populations.
STREAM is an interactive computational pipeline for reconstructing complex cellular developmental trajectories from sc-qPCR, scRNA-seq or scATAC-seq data.

Differential expression analysis across pseudotime. Identify genes that exhibit switch-like up or down regulation along single-cell trajectories along with where in the trajectory the regulation occurs.
Similarity Weighted Nonnegative Embedding (SWNE), is a method for visualizing high dimensional datasets.
SymSim (Synthetic model of multiple variability factors for Simulation) is an R package for simulation of single cell RNA-Seq data
A new computational method for determining such synergistic identity cores of subpopulations within a given cell population.
An information theory-based approach to uncover potential ligand-receptor interactions involved in tissue homeostasis and diseases
TASC (Toolkit for Analysis of Single Cell RNA-seq), an empirical Bayes approach to reliably model the cell-specific dropout rates and amplification bias by use of external RNA spike-ins.

TASIC uses a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) based on a probabilistic Kalman Filter approach to combine time and expression information for determining the branching process associated with time series single cell studies.
TBSP: Trajectory Inference Based on SNP information
TCM is an R package for visualizing temporal single cell RNA-seq data
Tumor micro-Environment Deconvolution (TED): A Fully Bayesian Inference of Tumor Microenvironment composition and gene expression
Tempora: cell trajectory inference using time-series single-cell RNA sequencing data
A tool for reconstructing Transfer Entropy-based causal gene NETwork from pseudo-time ordered single cell transcriptomic data
R Package for the classification of tumor-infiltrating CD8+ lymphocytes (TILs) from single-cell RNA-seq data
Truncated normal test for differential expression following clustering
Cluster single cells and analyze cell clade relationships with colorful visualizations.
Extracting and using probabilistic Waddington's landscape recreation from single cell gene expression measurements.
TraCeR - reconstruction of T cell receptor sequences from single-cell RNA-seq data.
tradeSeq provides a flexible method for discovering genes that are differentially expressed along one or multiple lineages, using a variety of tests suited to answer many questions of interest
Alignment of complex trajectories from single-cell RNAseq experiments.
TRAPeS (TCR Reconstruction Algorithm for Paired-End Single-cell),  software for reconstruction of T cell receptors (TCR) using short, paired-end single-cell RNA-sequencing.
A hierarchical clustering and visualization algorithm based on stacked one-dimensional t-SNE embeddings
Identify genes with spatial expression trends in single-cell gene-expression data.
TRUmiCount uses a mechanistic model of PCR amplification to correct for both amplification and lost molecule errors.
trVAE is a deep generative model which learns mapping between multiple different styles (conditions)
Pseudo-time reconstruction and evaluation in single-cell RNA-seq analysis.
TSEE: an elastic embedding method to visualize the dynamic gene expression patterns of time series single-cell RNA sequencing data
Transcriptional burst kinetics inference and analysis from allelic single-cell RNA-seq
The software identifies instances of sequence reads originating from the same mRNA molecule (sharing a UMI) but which map to a series of adjacent coordinates on the reference.
This repository contains tools for dealing with Unique Molecular Identifiers (UMIs)/Random Molecular Tags (RMTs).
Accelerating the deduplication and collapsing process for reads with Unique Molecular Identifiers (UMI)
umis provides tools for estimating expression in RNA-Seq data which performs sequencing of end tags of trancsript, and incorporate molecular tags to correct for amplification bias.
UNCURL is an unified framework for unsupervised / semi-supervised learning using Single Cell RNA-Seq data.
Unsupervised Topological Alignment for Single-Cell Multi-Omics Integration
UniPath provides robust statistical methods to represent every single cell using pathway and gene-set enrichment scores.

URD is an R package designed for reconstructing transcriptional trajectories underlying specification or differentiation processes in the form of a branching tree, using single cell RNA-sequencing data.

This package is designed to uncover the intrinsic cell progression path from single-cell RNA-seq data. It incorporates data pre-processing, preliminary PCA gene selection, preliminary cell ordering, feature selection, refined cell ordering, and post-analysis interpretation and visualization.
VAMF is a probabilistic dimension reduction method for single cell RNA-Seq datasets.
VarTrix is a software tool for extracting single cell variant information from 10x Genomics single cell data.
Variational autoencoder for single cell RNA-seq datasets
TCR and BCR reconstruction from scRNA-seq data
velocyto (velox + , quick cell) is a package for the analysis of expression dynamics single cell RNA seq data, in particuar it allows the estimation of the RNA velocity of single cells.

VIPER is based on nonnegative sparse regression models and is capable of progressively inferring a sparse set of local neighborhood cells that are most predictive of the expression levels of the cell of interest for imputation.
Vireo: Variational Inference for Reconstructing Ensemble Origin by expressed SNPs in multiplexed scRNA-seq data
VISION aids in the interpretation of single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) data by selecting for gene signatures which describe coordinated variation between cells
visnormsc is a Graphical User Interface (GUI) for normalization of single-cell RNA sequencing (RNA-seq) data.
Resolving human brain organoid heterogeneity through single-cell genomic comparison to spatial brain maps
VPAC,  accurate clustering of single-cell transcriptomic data through variational projection
WaveCrest is a statistical approach to reconstruct gene expression trajectory in single cell RNA-seq experiments with ordered conditions.
WEDGE is a weighted low-rank matrix completion algorithm for recovering scRNA-seq gene expression data with high dropout rate.
Wishbone is an algorithm to align single cells from differentiation systems with bifurcating branches.
Waddington-OT uses time-course data to infer how the probability distribution of cells in gene-expression space evolves over time, by using the mathematical approach of Optimal Transport (OT).
Wx: a neural network-based feature selection algorithm for next-generation sequencing data
In single-cell experiment performed in the presence of two organisms, such as xenograft experiment, XenoCell allows to extract cellular barcodes that are specific to one of the two organisms.
A quantile regression method for differential expression analysis of single-cell RNA-seq data
Zero-inflated dimensionality reduction algorithm for single-cell data.
Zero-inflated Negative Binomial based Wanted Variation Extraction (ZINB-WaVE)
zingeR: Zero-Inflated Negative binomial Gene Expression in R.
zUMIs is a fast and flexible pipeline to process RNA-seq data with UMIs
